required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Dorsolateral Versus Medial Prefrontal TMS for Depression

lead_sponsor.agency: White River Junction Veterans Affairs Medical Center

clinical_study.source: White River Junction Veterans Affairs Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aimed to help us learn about the effects of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation at the forehead versus the left side of the head for treatment of Treatment Resistant Depression.

detailed_description.textblock: While transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) to the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) is an FDA approved treatment for depression, a growing and converging database suggests the medial prefrontal cortex (MPFC) may be even more critical to the neurobiology of depression and antidepressant treatment response. This study will compare the efficacy of high frequency transcranial madntic stimulation on these two sections of the brain.

clinical_study.why_stopped: PI's discretion due to needing to modify study protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Depressive symptoms measured by the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline Hamilton-17 score to follow-up visit at 1 week after final TMS intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Depressive symptoms will be measured by the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive TMS. They will be randomized to either the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex or the medial prefrontal cortex.

After the experimental arm, if a patient was randomized to the medial prefrontal cortex during the experimental arm and it did not work for them, they have the option of returning for a session of TMS to the FDA-approved dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. If they were assigned to the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, they are not eligible to return for another set of treatment.

intervention.description: Transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) is a noninvasive procedure that uses magnetic fields to stimulate nerve cells in the brain to improve symptoms of depression.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 21-70 years old
- inadequate response to one current antidepressant medication
- currently depressed
Exclusion Criteria:
- psychiatric comorbidities

facility.name: White River Junction VA Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: White River Junction Veterans Affairs Medical Center
